gang.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a group of young people who spend time together, and who are often involved in crime or drugs and who often fight against other groups
gang.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: the problem of inner-city gang violence
The parents have denied that their son is a gang member.
gang.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a group of young people together in one place, especially young people who might cause trouble
gang.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: There were always gangs of kids hanging around the mall.
gang.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a group of criminals who work together
gang.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Several gangs were operating in the area.
gang.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a group of friends, especially young people
gang.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The whole gang will be there next weekend.
gang.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a group of workers or prisoners doing physical work together
gang.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: ADJECTIVES/NOUN + gang
a criminal gang
He had links with drug smuggling and criminal gangs.
an armed gang
An armed gang stole jewels worth more than five million pounds.
a rival gang
Fighting between rival gangs left dozens of people injured.
a street gang
He belonged to a notorious street gang which terrorized a Chicago suburb.
a teenage/youth gang
At age nine, Pedro joined one of the youth gangs in his neighborhood, just to survive.
gang + NOUN
a gang member/a member of a gang
Gang members are thought to be responsible for up to 20% of murders in the city.
a gang leader
Gang leaders used cellphones to order the attacks.
gang violence
Residents say that gang violence is common.
gang warfare
Gang warfare is wrecking the neighborhood.
gang crime
The initiative aims to cut gang crime in Los Angeles.
gang activity
In most areas, gun crime is linked to gang activity.
join a gang
He was only eight when he joined the gang.
belong to a gang
Eleven men belonging to a local gang were arrested.
